intro: Henslowia buxifolia, commonly known as the boxleaf henslowia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with small, glossy leaves that resemble those of boxwood. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and display a range of colors, from white to pink. Henslowia buxifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance.
